snippet: A Pentagon spokesman said United States officials were “working with the Turks to resume air operations there as soon as possible.”...
abstract: Turkish authorities temporarily halt all American-led strike missions flying out of Incirlik Air Base to fight Islamic State militants, latest ripple effect stemming from attempted military coup in country.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Dan Bilefsky from London.

lead_paragraph: A Pentagon spokesman said United States officials were “working with the Turks to resume air operations there as soon as possible.”

headline.main: Turkey Interrupts U.S. Air Missions Against ISIS at Major Base
headline.print_headline: Authorities Interrupt Missions Against ISIS at a Major Air Base

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
